output:
The last slice of pecan pie
Is laid out before my eyes
In plastic it's wrapped
All the memories trapped
In the shelf, the fridge, where it lies
So lovingly it was made
But still it must decay
Like the one from whose hand
Put the love in the pan
How quickly the moment will fade
So I'll pick a fork up in my hand
And I'll save a reach bite till the end
And I'll say my goodbye
To the last slice of pie
That I won't ever taste again
